name: 言談分析導論
goals: a survey of issues in language use, where language interacts with context.
syllabus:
**_Introduction to Discourse Analysis_** **(Spring 2022)**

Instructor: Miao-Hsia Chang   Time: 14:20-17:20 (Tue)  Office: Cheng Building 821

**I. Course Objective:**

            This course aims to introduce the fundamental concepts of discourse analysis, which is involved in the analysis of spoken and written language in use. The topics include cohesion and coherence, discourse and grammar, theme and rheme, intonation units, discourse markers, and discourse and vocabulary. Through the introduction of important concepts in the cohesion, coherence, and textuality of spoken or written discourse, students will learn to appreciate the importance of meaning of utterances/sentences beyond the sentence level and to acquire the basic skills in text and conversation analysis. Media materials will be brought into the class where necessary.
